intro: Gnidia hockii, commonly known as the Natal hakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the coastal regions of KwaZulu-Natal. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and dense, leathery foliage. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Gnidia hockii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
